column2: jetwriter, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Sanctura has made me pad free after a week. Since starting I've gained 15#, heat intolerance, major fatigue, muscle pain. I need to lay down every two hours just until the pain goes away. I've talked to Allegen. None of these side effects have been reported. I am on many meds but these symptoms are new since starting the sanctura. Has anyone else had these symptoms? On the bright side sanctura has really decreased my depression. The trade off isn't worth it. Going to talk with GU doc today.

column2: kristir, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have tried almost all of the other medications for OAB, and the implant surgery was the next option.  The doctor, as a last resort, started me on the Sanctura XR.  Within 3 days I was pad free and going when I wanted to instead of every 30 minutes when I had the urge.  Insurance would not pay for XR, so the doctor started me on the 20mg twice a day.  The dry mouth is not near as bad as with the XR, but I am getting the same great results for OAB.  I had both stress and urge incontinence, which is now almost nonexistent.  The only side effect is that it is difficult to take with my allergy medication. I have found a good time to take it each time, and by taking it two hours after dinner, it saves me from the "midnight snack".  I have only been on the medication for about a month, but I have had no issues, and am very thankful.  I hope it doesn't wear off.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Drug works well, although severe headaches and very blurred vision. I've taken it for 6-8 months but will stop mainly due to blurred vision.

column2: ellen, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i've had bladder cancer, resulting in OAB. this is the only med that does not cause dry eyes, mouth, etc. and i've been on it for @ 4 months.

column9: After the constipation caused by Detrol I gave this a try.  Not great results but definitely better than nothing.  No real side effects either.

column2: twinkie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was getting up 4-5 times a night to urinate and several times a day. I felt controlled by my bladder. I eat a lot of fiber and drink lots of water this helps.

column9: I have been taking Sanctura for almost one  month and it has really made a difference in stopping frequent urination and pressure to urinate. I am debating whether to stay on this drug or try another.

column2: Cathnomore, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Sanctura 60mg for a couple of months.  Recently started taking it first thing in the morning to guarantee an empty stomach.  I was not satisfied with the results to that point.  Dry mouth increased to near intolerable levels.  So I guess it really did help to have a totally empty stomach. Well, today I had to go to the emergency room for urine retention...inability to urinate.  Did not enjoy the catheter experience and will stop the Sanctura all together.  Was 60mg to high a dose?

column2: Betty, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month

I have been in the bad habit of drinking too little most of my life. I feel better all the way around!

column2: Web MD, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column1: Urine Leakage When there is a Strong Desire to Void
column2: Mesa Verde , 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started Sanctura when bladder support surgery did not stop leakage. I chose Santura from three medications because it seemed to dry out my mouth slightly less than the other medications. Today I stopped the drug after a dental checkup revealed four teeth with pockets measuring 6, a peridontal condition caused by a dry mouth. Normally, saliva helps keep bacteria in check. Before Santura, my gums had a normal measurements of 3. I'm having $1,800 in root planing to remove bacteria below the gumline. I realized that I won't miss Sanctura much. I wear pads to protect against wetness anyway. There's no protection from leakage when sneezing or coughing. The urge to urinate seems to come too late to make it to the restroom so I have to maintain an awareness and make more frequent trips to the restroom. If I were to remain on Sanctura, I'd have to drink fluids continuously to keep my mouth from getting dry. This would counteract the supposed benefit of Sanctura but wouldn't address the issue of a mouth that goes completely dry for seven hours a day, endangering my otherwise healthy teeth.

column2: maury, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I started with just sanctura 20 mg,my dr. reciommended that I begin the new sanctura xr.One day after starting this dose, i had chest pressure and went to hospital. They found nothing wrong with my heart. My feeling is it may be the santura since that is the only change in my life. I wil start taking it at bedtime and see how that works.There is no side effects that I can find to support the chest pressure from sanctura. I do love how it has helped my overall symptoms and would recommend it to others with over active bladder.Most side effects of drugs do lessen or go away and I like sanctura too much to just give it up without a good try with the new xr.
